thread.title: JOSHUA TREE: Deputies witness shots fired near patrol car
thread.title_full: JOSHUA TREE: Deputies witness shots fired near patrol car - Press Enterprise

author: ALI TADAYON
title: JOSHUA TREE: Deputies witness shots fired near patrol car
text:
BY ALI TADAYON / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 2, 2015 Updated: 4:57 p.m. JOSHUA TREE: Deputies witness shots fired near patrol car Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Related article » POLICE SEEK INFORMATION The Sheriff's Department asks that anyone with information about the incident or the identity of the suspect contact the Morongo Basin Sheriff’s Station at 760-366-4175. Callers wishing to remain anonymous may leave information on the WE-Tip Hotline by calling 1-800-78-CRIME or by accessing the web site at www.wetip.com.
San Bernardino County sheriff's deputies on Thursday, Oct. 1, heard and saw shots being fired near their patrol car in Joshua Tree.
The deputies were unsure if the shots were intended for them, according to a Sheriff's Department news release, and the shooter remained at large Friday.
The deputies were parked at the intersection of Mountain View Circle and Twentynine Palms Highway about 11:45 p.m. when the incident occurred, the news release said.
They heard about five shots and saw five muzzle flashes east of their patrol car, coming from a trailer park in the 62400 block of Twentynine Palms Highway.
The deputies found 10 .45-caliber spent shell casings and a tactical gun light at the west entrance of the trailer park, the news release said. A witness at the trailer park told deputies she saw a dark colored SUV leave the area at a high rate of speed after she heard shots fired.
The Sheriff's Department asks that anyone with information about the incident or the identity of the suspect contact the Morongo Basin Sheriff’s Station at 760-366-4175. Callers wishing to remain anonymous may leave information on the WE-Tip Hotline by calling 1-800-78-CRIME or by accessing the web site at www.wetip.com.
